AB: AN INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED PROBLEM IS THE UNCONTROLLED CONVERSION OF FOREST INTO OTHER LAND COVER TYPES. MOST ATTENTION IS FOCUSSED ON THE RAPID DISAPPEARANCE OF TROPICAL RAINFORESTS, ALTHOUGH DEFORESTATION IS ALSO A PROBLEM ON HIGHER LATITUDES. EFFORTS TO CURB AND REGULATE THE CLEARING OF TROPICAL RAINFORESTS HAVE OFTEN BEEN HAMPERED, NOT ONLY BY THE COMPLEXITY OF THE SOCIAL, ECONOMICAL AND POLITICAL FACTORS DRIVING DEFORESTATION, BUT ALSO BY THE SCARCITY OF UP-TO-DATE INFORMATION ON THE LOCATION, EXTENT AND SPEED OF THE PROCESS. AS EXTENSIVE FIELD DATA COLLECTION IS NOT FEASIBLE BECAUSE OF POOR ACCESSIBILITY, REMOTE SENSING, ESPECIALLY RADAR, CAN PROVIDE A VIABLE SOLUTION FOR MAPPING AND MONITORING SUCH AREAS. THE MONITORING SYSTEM PRESENTED HERE, IS BASED ON IMAGES OF THE ERS-1&2 SATELLITES. IT HAS A GENERIC STRUCTURE, MAKING IT SUITABLE FOR APPLICATION IN A WIDE RANGE OF AREAS BY REPLACING ONLY A FEW SPECIFIC COMPONENTS. THE SYSTEM WAS APPLIED IN THE PILOT SITE OF SAN JOSE DEL GUAVIARE, IN THE AMAZON RAINFOREST OF COLOMBIA. PEOPLE FROM OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTRY MIGRATE TO THIS AREA IN SEARCH OF LAND AND LIVELIHOOD, CLEARING PARTS OF THE FOREST, CULTIVATING CROPS AND ULTIMATELY PLANTING PASTURES FOR CATTLE BREEDING. FIELD DATA WERE COLLECTED BETWEEN 1990 AND 1994 IN THE PILOT AREA. DURING THE PERIOD 1992-1994, SEVEN ERS-1 IMAGES WERE AVAILABLE. DESCRIPTIONS OF TYPE AND STRUCTURE OF THE LAND COVER WERE ANALYZED TOGETHER WITH REMOTE SENSING DATA, TO FORMULATE LAND COVER CLASSES THAT ARE BOTH MEANINGFUL TO THE USER OF THE SYSTEM AS WELL AS INTERPRETABLE BY MEANS OF TIME SERIES OF ERS-1&2 IMAGES. THESE LAND COVER CLASSES ARE CHARACTERIZED BY IMAGE CHARACTERISTICS, SUCH AS THE AVERAGE LEVEL OF RADAR BACKSCATTER PER SEGMENT AND THE VARIATION IN THE LEVEL OF BACKSCATTER OVER THREE SUBSEQUENT IMAGES. SIMULATION OF LEVEL AND VARIATION OF BACKSCATTER OF DIFFERENT LAND COVER CLASSES WITH THE THEORETICAL MODEL UTACAN CONFIRMED THE EXPERIMENTAL FINDINGS. PRIOR TO CLASSIFICATION, IMAGES WERE SEGMENTED WITH THE RSEG ALGORITHM, BASED ON EDGE DETECTION AND SEGMENT GROWING. THE PROCESS OF LAND COVER CHANGE OCCURRING IN THE PILOT AREA, WAS MODELED BY A LAND COVER CHANGE MODEL BOSTOS. THIS MODEL IS USED TO CALCULATE THE POSSIBLE CHANGES IN LAND COVER CLASSES BETWEEN TWO MOMENTS IN TIME. BY USING THIS MODEL, UNLIKELY CHANGES WERE EXCLUDED AND MONITORING BECOMES MORE ACCURATE. TWO SETS OF FORMAL RULES WERE DEVELOPED FOR THE CLASSIFICATION OF THE TIME SERIES OF ERS-1 IMAGES OF THE PILOT SITE: THE FIRST SET IS BASED ON THE RELATION BETWEEN LAND COVER CLASS AND BACKSCATTER SIGNATURE, AS DESCRIBED ABOVE. THE SECOND SET DESCRIBES THE POSSIBLE CHANGES IN LAND COVER AS CALCULATED BY BOSTOS. THESE SETS WERE APPLIED TO THE SEVEN IMAGES FOR IMAGE CLASSIFICATION AND LAND COVER CHANGE DETECTION. RESULTS SHOW THAT, WHILE IT IS DIFFICULT TO MAP LAND COVER WITH ONE SINGLE ERS-1 IMAGE, THREE IMAGES OVER A TIME SPAN OF ONE YEAR CAN SEPARATE FORESTS FROM PASTURES, PROVIDED THE IMAGES WERE TAKEN IN DIFFERENT SEASONS. SECONDARY VEGETATION IS A VERY HETEROGENEOUS CLASS, CONFUSED BOTH WITH FOREST AND WITH PASTURES. TIME SERIES OF ERS-1 IMAGES OVER SEVERAL YEARS CAN ALSO SEPARATE SECONDARY VEGETATION FROM FORESTS AND PASTURES, WITH ACCURACY INCREASING WITH THE TIME THE MONITORING SYSTEM IS FUNCTIONING AND THE NUMBER OF IMAGES.

AB: THIS ARTICLE PRESENTS A METHODOLOGY FOR SELECTING TEXTURE MEASURES TO MAXIMIZE THE DISCRIMINATION OF AGRICULTURAL LAND USE CLASSES IN SAR IMAGES. THE IMAGES WERE ACQUIRED DURING THE FIRST FLIGHT OF THE SHUTTLE IMAGING RADAR-C (SIR-C) EXPERIMENT, IN APRIL 1994. L (24 CM)- AND C (5 CM)-BAND SAR DATA AT HH (HORIZONTAL TRANSMITTING AND RECEIVING). HV (HORIZONTAL TRANSMITTING, VERTICAL RECEIVING), AND VV (VERTICAL TRANSMITTING AND RECEIVING) POLARIZATIONS BOTH IN GROUND RANGE AND SLANT RANGE AND IN TWO DIFFERENT PASSES WERE ANALYZED. THE KAPPA STATISTIC WAS USED TO IDENTIFY MEANINGFUL TEXTURE MEASURES TO DISCRIMINATE SEVEN CLASSES. THE RESULTS SHOW THAT THE CLASSIFICATIONS OF LAND USE BASED ONLY ON TONAL AVERAGES PRODUCED A KAPPA COEFFICIENT ONLY SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN 0.50. A KAPPA THRESHOLD OF 0.90 WAS REACHED WITH THE SIMULTANEOUS INCLUSION OF 15 TEXTURE MEASURES FOR THE SIX IMAGES (TWO BANDS, THREE POLARIZATIONS). IT WAS ALSO FOUND THAT THE INCLUSION OF TEXTURE FEATURES WHEN ONLY ONE BAND AND ONE POLARIZATION WAS USED COULD PRODUCE KAPPA VALUES HIGHER THAN 0.85.

OF COMPUTER SCIENCE, (REPORT FOR THE CANADIAN CENTRE FOR REMOTE SENSING
AB: EVIDENCE FOR IMAGE CLASSIFICATION CAN BE CONSIDERED TO COME FROM TWO SOURCES: TRADITIONAL STATISTICAL INFORMATION DERIVED ALGORITHMICALLY FROM IMAGE DATA, AND MODEL-BASED EVIDENCE ARISING FROM PREVIOUS EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE IN A GIVEN APPLICATION DOMAIN. THIS PAPER PRESENTS A STUDY OF CLASSIFICATION TECHNIQUES BASED ON BOTH THESE SOURCES (TRADITIONAL ALGORITHMIC AND MODEL-BASED), AND ILLUSTRATES HOW THEY CAN BE COMBINED. A PROTOTYPE IMAGE CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM, CALLED CABARESS, HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED WHICH IMPLEMENTS THESE METHODS. WE EVALUATE CABARESS AS APPLIED TO THE PROBLEM OF IDENTIFYING CROPS IN AGRICULTURAL FIELDS, BASED ON CLASSIFYING IMAGE SEGMENTS EXTRACTED FROM RADAR IMAGE DATA. OUR RESULTS DEMONSTRATE THIS MIXED-METHOD APPROACH CAN ACHIEVE IMPROVED CLASSIFICATIONAL ACCURACY.

J. REMOTE SENSING, 16 (14), PP. 2619-263
AB: THE CURRENT STUDY INVESTIGATES THE POTENTIAL OF ERS-1 SAR DATA FOR RICE MAPPING AND RICE CROP MONITORING. THE SELECTED STUDY AREA IS LOCATED IN KANCHANABURI PROVINCE, WEST-THAILAND. THE RICE GROWING AREA IS IRRIGATED, FLAT, HOMOGENEOUSLY MANAGED, AND HAS LARGE INDIVIDUAL FIELDS OF AT LEAST ONE HECTARE SIZE. AS REGARDS RICE MAPPING A DIGITAL CLASSIFICATION BASED ON MULTI-TEMPORAL, SPECKLE-FILTERED ERS-1 SAR IMAGES WAS CARRIED OUT TO DETERMINE RICE FIELD ACREAGE. THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY FOR RICE FIELDS IS 89%. AS REGARDS RICE CROP MONITORING THE RADAR BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT SO [DB] OF RICE FIELDS WAS RELATED TO VARIOUS PHENOLOGICAL PARAMETERS ON A FIELD-BY-FIELD BASIS, SUCH AS PLANT HEIGHT, PLANT MOISTURE CONTENT, STALK DIAMETER, LEAF SIZE, OCCURRENCE OF STANDING WATER AND CROP YIELD. IT WAS FOUND THAT THERE IS A GOOD CORRELATION BETWEEN PLANT HEIGHT AND SO AND BETWEEN CROP YIELD AND SO, RESPECTIVELY. THE RESULTS ARE CLEARLY POINTING TOWARDS THE OPERATIONAL APPLICATION OF THE METHODOLOGY AND CONFIRM THAT ERS-1 SAR DATA CAN BE USED FOR THE PURPOSE OF RICE CROP MAPPING AND MONITORING. THE USE OF RADAR DATA FOR RICE MONITORING IS OF PARTICULAR INTEREST BECAUSE RICE IS MAINLY GROWN IN TROPICAL REGIONS WITH QUASI PERMANENT CLOUD COVER DURING THE GROWING SEASON.

J. REM. SENS., 16 (14), PP. 2619-2637; ULABY, F.T., MOORE, R.K., FUNG, A.K., (1986) MICROWAVE REMOTE SENSING ACTIVE AND PASSIVE. VOLUME 3. FROM THEORY TO APPLICATIONS, 3. , ARTECH HOUSE, NORWOOD, MASSACHUSETT
AB: IN THIS PAPER, THE RESULTS OF A PRE-OPERATIONAL STUDY ON THE USE OF ERS-1 BACKSCATTERING SIGNATURES FOR EARLY SEASON AGRICULTURAL CROP CLASS DISCRIMINATION ARE DISCUSSED. THE USE OF THESE DATA IS BASED ON THE UNDERSTANDING THAT MICROWAVE BACKSCATTERING SIGNATURES OF BARE FIELD CARRY INFORMATION ON THE SURFACE STRUCTURE OF THE FIELD, WHICH IS A REFLECTION OF THE FIELD PREPARATIONS CARRIED OUT FOR SPECIFIC CROPPING REGIMES IN AN AREA. THUS, WE TEST OUR HYPOTHESIS THAT ERS-1 SIGNATURES CAN BE USED TO IDENTIFY CROP SPECIFIC TILTHS THAT PRECEDE THE ACTUAL GROWTH STAGE OF THE CROP. WE SHOW THE USE OF THIS METHODOLOGY FOR MULTI-TEMPORAL ERS-1 SAR IMAGERY OF THE MARS ACTION B SITE AT GREAT DRIFFIELD, UNITED KINGDOM. THE DATA SET ENCOMPASSES 21 IMAGES BETWEEN JUNE 1994 AND JULY 1995. THE ANALYSIS OF THE ERS-1 DATA HAS BEEN SUPPORTED BY NUMEROUS ANCILLARY DATA SETS, OF WHICH METEOROLOGICAL RECORDS, CROP CLASSIFICATION RESULTS OF THE PREVIOUS SEASON (1994) AND A RAPID GROUND SURVEY IN THE SPRING OF 1995 ARE THE MOST IMPORTANT. OUR ANALYSIS SHOWS THAT WELL-CHOSEN EARLY SEASON IMAGERY CAN SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE CROP CLASS SEPARATION WITH ERS-1 IMAGERY. THE STUDY HAS ALSO LEAD TO VARIOUS RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF A CROP CLASSIFICATION METHODOLOGY BASED ON THE USE OF SAR SIGNATURES.

FIRST WORKSHOP ON ERS-1 PILOT PROJECTS, PP. 61-73. , TOLEDO, SPAIN, JUNE; NEZRY, E., RMONDIRE, S., SOLAAS, G., GENOVESE, G., MAPPING OF NEXT SEASON'S CROPS DURING THE WINTER USING ERS SAR DATA (1995) EOQ, (50). , DEC. 1995; VOSSEN, P., (1995) EARLY CROP STATE MONITORING AND YIELD PREDICTION FOR THE EUROPEAN UNION, 120P. , EUR PUBLICATION, OFFICE FOR OFFICIAL PUBLICATIONS OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, LUXEMBOURG; WOODING, M.G., ZMUDA, A.D., GRIFFITHS, G.H., (1993) PROC. 2ND ERS-1 SYMP., PP. 51-56. , HAMBURG, OCTOBER 199
AB: A METHODOLOGY TO INFER CROP STATISTICS FROM TIME SERIES OF RADAR AND OPTICAL HIGH-RESOLUTION IMAGES HAS BEEN DEVELOPED, TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE RADAR AND OPTICAL SENSORS COMPLEMENTARITY. A SUPERVISED CROP CLASSIFICATION IS PERFORMED USING THE BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT TIME PROFILES DERIVED ON A FIELD BASIS. FIELDS ARE SEGMENTED ON A CLOUD-FREE LANDSAT-TM IMAGE WHICH MIGHT BE DATED FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR. THANKS TO THE ERS-1 REVISIT FREQUENCY, THE METHOD ALLOWS TO PROVIDE CROP STATISTICS AS SOON AS CROPS CAN BE IDENTIFIED FROM THEIR BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT (I.E. EARLY IN SPRING). ON THE TEST SITE OF ZUID FLEVOLAND, A MEAN CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY OF 70% HAS BEEN REACHED USING ERS-1 IMAGES ONLY, AND IMPROVED TO 79% BY ADDING THE UNIQUE AVAILABLE CLOUD-FREE LANDSAT-TM IMAGE OF THAT YEAR. IN AN OPERATIONAL CONTEXT, THIS METHOD USING OFF-THE-SHELF SOFTWARE AND WIDELY AVAILABLE IMAGES IS ROBUST AND DOES NOT SUFFER FROM ANY TIME DELAY ASSOCIATED WITH THE AVAILABILITY OF CLOUD-FREE OPTICAL IMAGES DURING THE GROWING SEASON.

AB: OPERATIONAL METHODOLOGIES FOR IMPROVING AGRICULTURAL CROP IDENTIFICATION ARE TESTED USING C-HH AND C-HV AIRBORNE SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) DATA COLLECTED ON JULY 10, 1990, FOR A TEST SITE IN OXFORD COUNTY, SOUTHERN ONTARIO. RAW SAR DATA, FILTERED SAR DATA, AND SAR TEXTURE STATISTICS ARE CLASSIFIED USING PIXEL- AND FIELD-CLASSIFICATION APPROACHES TO DETERMINE THEIR EFFECTIVENESS FOR AGRICULTURAL CROP CLASSIFICATION. TEXTURE STATISTICS DERIVED FROM THE CONDITIONAL JOINT PROBABILITY DENSITY FUNCTIONS OF THE GREY-LEVEL COOCCURRENCE MATRIX FOR SAR IMAGES POSSESS SUPERIOR DISCRIMINATION POWER COMPARED TO THE STATISTICS FOR THE RAW DATA. A FIELD CLASSIFICATION, HOWEVER, PROVIDES SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVED CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES FOR A VARIETY OF INPUT DATA.  1995 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

AB: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PAPER IS TO EVALUATE THE APPLICATION OF TEXTURE AND MULTIPOLARISATION DATA FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE IS SUBDIVIDED INTO THREE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES. THE FIRST IS TO EVALUATE THE APPLICATION OF MULTIPOLARISATION DATA FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION. THE SECOND IS TO EVALUATE THE CONTRIBUTION OF TEXTURE DATA TO CROP CLASSIFICATION FROM MULTIPOLARISATION DATA. THE THIRD OBJECTIVE IS TO DEVELOP A NEW APPROACH ALLOWING FOR ADEQUATE AND FLEXIBLE INTEGRATION OF MULTIPOLARISATION AND TEXTURAL ANALYSIS. BASED ON THESE OBJECTIVES, THE STUDY WAS SUBDIVIDED INTO THREE PARTS. IN THE FIRST PART, TWO CLASSIFICATION METHODS, SUPERVISED AND UNSUPERVISED, WERE USED. THE RESULTS INDICATE THAT DATA FROM MULTIPOLARISATION ARE APPROPRIATE FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION AND PROVIDE SUPERIOR DISCRIMINATION RESULTS (10 TO 20% BETTER) COMPARED TO THE USE OF A SINGLE POLARISATION. THE RESULTS FROM THE SECOND PART, ON ONE HAND, INDICATE THAT HIGH VALUE ENHANCEMENT AND MEAN PARAMETERS FOR TEXTURE, DERIVED FROM THE THIRD AND FIRST ORDER HISTOGRAM RESPECTIVELY, PROVIDE THE BEST DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN CROPS. ON THE OTHER HAND, THE INTEGRATION OF THE BEST PARAMETERS FOR TEXTURE THAT WERE STUDIED USING MULTIPOLARISATION DATA PROVIDED IMPROVED CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES BY ABOUT 10%. IN THE LAST PART, THE NEW APPROACH OF INTEGRATING MULTIPOLARISATION AND TEXTURE DATA COMPARED TO THE CONVENTIONAL METHOD PERMITTED A REDUCTION OF THE NUMBER OF NON-CLASSIFIED PIXELS AND A REDUCTION OF THE TIME FOR COMPUTATION BY 30%, AND AT THE SAME TIME STILL PROVIDING THE SAME PERFORMANCE FOR DISCRIMINATION AND A BETTER SPATIAL ACCURACY.  1995 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

column1: HUADONG G, 1995, GEOCARTO INT
AU: HUADONG, G; CHAO, W; JINGJUAN, L; YUN, S; CHENGJIE, W
CR: BAYER, W.C., CAMPBELL, F., LAPP, D., (1993) GLOBESAR: A CANADIAN PROGRAM TO PREPARE USES FOR, THE OPERATIONAL USE OF RADAR DATA IN THE 1990'S, , PRESENTED AT THE INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM OF OPERATIONALIZATION OF REMOTE SENSING; PARASBAR, S., SPECIAL ISSUE RADARSAT (1993) CANADIAN JOURNAL OF REMOTE SENSING, 19 (4). , GUEST EDITOR; HUADONG, G., SPACEBORNE RADAR FOR GEOSCIENTIFIC APPLICATIONS IN NORTH CHINA", IN JPL (1993) PROCEEDINGS OF THE THIRD SPACEBORNE IMAGING RADAR SYMPOSIUM, PP. 417-41
AB: C/X BAND AND HH, HV, VH, VV POLARIZATION SAR DATA OF ZHAOQING TEST SITE IN SOUTHERN CHINA HAVE BEEN ACQUIRED IN NOVEMBER, 1993, AS PART OF THE GLOBESAR PROGRAM. THESE DATA HAVE BEEN PROCESSED USING THE PCI SOFTWARE (PCI INC.) AND ANALYZED WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE FIELD INVESTIGATION. THIS PAPER PRESENTS SOME SCIENTIFIC RESULTS OF THE SAR APPLICATIONS IN THE FIELDS OF GEOLOGY, FORESTRY, AGRICULTURE, AND HYDROLOGY. GEOLOGIC EXPERIMENTS WERE CONDUCTED TO STUDY ROCK TYPE DIELECTRICS AND GOLD MINERALIZATION ZONES. A FORESTRY EXPLORATION EXPERIMENT AIMS TO INVESTIGATE THE FOREST TYPE DISCRIMINATION. THE AGRICULTURE EXPERIMENT IS CONDUCTED TO STUDY LAND COVER AND CROP TYPE CLASSIFICATION. THE HYDROLOGY EXPERIMENT IS MAINLY FOR STUDYING THE RIVER CHANNEL PROCESSES AND DETERMINING THE SUBMERGED AREA DUE TO FLOODING BY COMPARING THE GLOBESAR DATA WITH CASSAR DATA. SIGNIFICANT RESULTS HAVE BEEN ACHIEVED IN THE FOUR APPLICATION AREAS. IT IS SHOWN THAT RADAR REMOTE SENSING TECHNOLOGY, ESPECIALLY WITH MULTI-BAND AND MULTI-POLARIZATION, IS A USEFUL TOOL FOR EARTH RESOURCE OBSERVATION.  1995 TAYLOR AND FRANCIS LTD.

column1: BORGEAUD M, 1995, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: BORGEAUD, M; NOLL, J; BELLINI, A
CR: NA
AB: THE SITE CHOSEN FOR THIS INVESTIGATION IS FLEVOLAND IN THE NETHERLANDS. THE TERRAIN IS VERY UNIFORM AND CONSISTS EITHER OF CROPS OR BARE SOILS EARLY AND LATE IN THE SEASON. SEVENTEEN ERS-1 SAR PRECISION IMAGES IN PRI FORMAT COLLECTED IN 1993 ARE USED AS WELL AS GROUND DATA MEASURED BY LOCAL INVESTIGATORS AT THE TIME OF THE OVERFLY. DUE TO THE FLATNESS OF THIS AGRICULTURAL TERRAIN, THERE IS NO NEED FOR TOPOGRAPHIC CORRECTION OF THE SAR DATA. BECAUSE OF THE EXCELLENT STABILITY OF THE ERS-1 SPACEBORNE SATELLITE, IT IS POSSIBLE TO MAKE MULTI-TEMPORAL OBSERVATIONS OVER THE SITE. THIS TECHNIQUE IS USED TO ACCURATELY EXTRACT TEMPORAL PROFILES OF THE BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT FOR SEVERAL CROPS SUCH AS WINTER WHEAT, POTATOES, SUGARBEETS, BARLEY, LUCERNE, AND GRASS. THE POSSIBLE USE OF SUCH 'SIGNATURES' FOR IDENTIFICATION AND CLASSIFICATION PURPOSE IS INVESTIGATED.

column1: ASCHBACHER J, 1995, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: ASCHBACHER, J; PONGSRIHADULCHAI, A; KARNCHANSAUTHAM, S; RODPROM, C; PAUDYAL, D; LE, T, T
CR: NA
AB: THE CURRENT STUDY INVESTIGATES THE POTENTIAL OF ERS-1 SAR DATA FOR RICE FIELD MAPPING AND RICE CROP MONITORING. THE SELECTED STUDY AREA IS APPROXIMATELY 1515 KM IN SIZE AND IS LOCATED IN KANCHANABURI PROVINCE, WEST-THAILAND. THE RICE GROWING AREA IS IRRIGATED, FLAT, HOMOGENEOUSLY MANAGED, AND HAS LARGE INDIVIDUAL FIELDS OF AT LEAST ONE HECTARE SIZE. AS REGARDS RICE FIELD MAPPING A DIGITAL CLASSIFICATION BASED ON MULTI-TEMPORAL, SPECKLE-FILTERED ERS-1 SAR IMAGES WAS CARRIED OUT TO DETERMINE RICE FIELD ACREAGE. THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY FOR RICE FIELDS IS 89%. AS REGARDS RICE CROP MONITORING THE RADAR BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT S [DB] OF RICE FIELDS WAS RELATED TO VARIOUS PHENOLOGICAL PARAMETERS ON A FIELD-BY-FIELD BASIS, SUCH AS PLANT HEIGHT, PLANT MOISTURE CONTENT, STALK DIAMETER, LEAF SIZE, OCCURRENCE OF STANDING WATER AND CROP YIELD. IT WAS FOUND THAT THERE IS A GOOD CORRELATION BETWEEN PLANT HEIGHT AND S AND BETWEEN CROP YIELD AND S, RESPECTIVELY.

column1: STOLZ R, 1995, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: STOLZ, R; MAUSER, W
CR: NA
AB: FOR THE FIRST TIME RADAR DATA IN THREE FREQUENCIES (X-,C-L-BAND) AND IN MULTIPOLARISATION (HH, HV, VV, TOTAL POWER) ARE RECORDED SIMULTANEOUSLY IN ORBIT DURING THE SHUTTLE MISSION STS-59 IN APRIL 1994. THE AIM OF THIS WORK IS TO IMPROVE LANDUSE CLASSIFICATIONS WITH X-SAR/SIR-C RADAR DATA. THE DATA USED ARE MULTITEMPORAL X-SAR DATA (X-BAND) AND SIR-C (C- AND L-BAND) DATA OF APRIL 11, 1994. AS A FIRST STEP, THE DATA WERE CORREGISTERED. FROM THIS DATA SET THREE DIFFERENT BAND COMBINATIONS WERE SELECTED: MULTITEMPORAL X-BAND DATA, MULTIPOLARISED C-AND L-BAND OF APRIL 11 AND A DATA SET OF THE FIRST TWO PRINCIPAL COMPONENTS OF EACH FREQUENCY. ALL THREE SETS WERE CLASSIFIED USING A MAXIMUM LIKELIHOOD CLASSIFIER. FINALLY, A FIELDWISE POSTCLASSIFICATION ALGORITHM WAS APPLIED BASED ON THE MAJORITY RULE AND THE RESULTS WERE COMPARED WITH A DIGITAL GROUND TRUTH MAP IN A TWO-DIMENSIONAL ACCURACY MATRIX. FOR A COMPLETE AND EXACT ASSESSMENT OF THE LANDUSE CLASSIFICATION CAPABILITIES THE ACQUISITION DATE WAS UNFAVOURABLE DUE TO THE LIMITED NUMBER OF AGRICULTURAL CROPS AT THAT TIME. ONLY WINTER-CEREALS AND RAPE SEED HAD ALREADY EMERGED. HOWEVER, VEGETATION COVER ON THESE FIELDS RANGED FROM APPROXIMATELY ONLY 20% UP TO 80%.

AB: THIS STUDY EXPLORED THE APPLICATION OF MULTI-BAND/MULTI-FREQUENCY SIR-C/X-SAR IMAGES TO AGRICULTURAL REMOTE SENSING. THE SENSITIVITY OF THE BACKSCATTERED SIGNAL WITH RESPECT TO CROP OR LAND COVER TYPE AS WELL AS CROP CONDITIONS IS EVALUATED. DATA USED FOR THE STUDY ENCOMPASSES TWO WELL-SEPARATED TEST SITES, ONE IN SOUTHERN GERMANY AND THE OTHER IN NORTHERN ITALY.

OTTAWA: STATISTICS CANAD
AB: SOIL CONSERVATION IS KEY TO THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE CANADIAN PRAIRIE AGRICULTURAL ECOSYSTEM, BUT INFORMATION ON THE EXTENT OF THE ADOPTION OF SOIL CONSERVATION PRACTICES IS SCANT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS STUDY WAS TO DETERMINE THE POTENTIAL OF MULTI-TEMPORAL, MULTI-SENSOR REMOTE SENSING DATA TO IDENTIFY MANAGEMENT PRACTICES THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH SUSTAINING AGRICULTURAL RESOURCES. GROUND COVER DATA WERE COLLECTED AT THREE TEST SITES IN SOUTHERN ALBERTA TO COINCIDE WITH THE ACQUISITION OF AIRBORNE SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR), EARTH RESOURCES SATELLITE (ERS-1), AND VISIBLE-INFRARED LANDSAT THEMATIC MAPPER (TM) DATA. THE GROUND AND SATELLITE DATA WERE INTEGRATED IN A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS), AND A HIERARCHICAL CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM WAS DEVELOPED TO SEPARATE GROUND COVER TYPES. SPRING LANDSAT TM IMAGERY WAS USED TO DISTINGUISH PERENNIAL FROM ANNUAL CROPS. ANNUAL CEREALS, OILSEEDS, AND FALLOW WERE DISTINGUISHED USING SUMMER LANDSAT TM IMAGERY. RADAR IMAGERY IN THE FALL WAS USED TO ESTIMATE TILLAGE PRACTICES IN FALLOW AND CROPPED LAND. THE ACTUAL AREA OF ANNUAL AND PERENNIAL LAND COVER, ANNUAL CEREALS, OILSEED AND FALLOW, AND THOSE PREDICTED WAS SIMILAR. ZERO AND CONVENTIONALLY TILLED FALLOW AS WELL AS FALL-CULTIVATED STUBBLE WERE IDENTIFIED USING FALL AIRBORNE RADAR. THE ACCURACY OF CLASSIFICATION VARIED WITH TOPOGRAPHY.  1995 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

column1: ANYS H, 1994, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: ANYS, H; HE, D; WANG, L; GWYN, Q
CR: NA
AB: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS RESEARCH IS TO STUDY THE CONTRIBUTION OF MULTIPOLARIZATION AIRBORNE RADAR DATA TO CROP DISCRIMINATION. AN UNSUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION ALGORITHM AND A SUPERVISED METHOD BASED ON MAXIMUM LIKELIHOOD WERE USED AND COMPARED FOR AGRICULTURAL APPLICATIONS. THE EXPERIMENTAL AREA, IN SOUTHERN ONTARIO (CANADA), WAS CHOSEN BECAUSE IT HAS BEEN THE SITE OF EXTENSIVE INVENTORY IN RELATION TO THE APPLICATION OF VIR AND RADAR DATA FOR AGRICULTURAL USES. C-HH, C-VV AND C-HV DATA FOR 10 JULY 1990 WERE USED FOR OUR STUDY. AT THIS TIME, CROP DEVELOPMENT ALLOWS OPTIMAL SEPARABILITY BETWEEN CROPS. RESULTS SHOW THAT MULTIPOLARIZED RADAR DATA OFFER AN ADEQUATE TOOL FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION. CORRECT CLASSIFICATION RATES OF 83% AND 79% WERE OBTAINED FOR SUPERVISED AND UNSUPERVISED METHODS RESPECTIVELY. COMPARISON OF THE TWO METHODS REVEALS THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF THE UNSUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION IS SIMILAR TO THAT OF THE SUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION. THIS IS A PROMISING RESULT IF WE TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION THE FACT THAT THE UNSUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION ELIMINATES TEDIOUS EFFORT FOR DATA COLLECTION AND THAT IT MAKES MORE EFFICIENT USE OF COMPUTER TIME IN THE TRAINING STAGE.
C1: UNIVERSITE DE SHERBROOKE, SHERBROOKE, CANADA

column1: MULLINS DW, 1994, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: MULLINS, D; PULTZ, T; LUKOWSKI, T
CR: NA
AB: ERS-1 SCENES COVERING THE OTTAWA REGION WERE ACQUIRED EVERY 35 DAYS FOR THE PERIOD MAY 1992 THROUGH NOVEMBER 1993. THE DATA WERE CALIBRATED AND USED TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTS OF HYDROLOGICALLY SIGNIFICANT ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS ON BACKSCATTER FROM A VARIETY OF LAND COVERS TARGETS. A LAND COVER CLASSIFICATION DERIVED FROM LANDSAT TM DATA WAS USED TO FACILITATE EXTRACTION OF BACKSCATTER STATISTICS FOR CLASSES SUCH AS WETLANDS, CONIFEROUS AND DECIDUOUS FOREST, PASTURE, BARE SOIL, AND A VARIETY OF CROP TARGETS. ASSOCIATED METEOROLOGICAL DATA AND GROUND INFORMATION WERE USED IN THE INTERPRETATION OF BACKSCATTER RESPONSE. EACH CLASS EXHIBITED A SIMILAR PATTERN OF SEASONAL VARIATION IN BACKSCATTER, HOWEVER, THE MAGNITUDES DIFFERED. THE SMALLEST SEASONAL RANGE OF 5 DB WAS ASSOCIATED WITH FOREST TYPES WHILE GREATER VARIATION WAS EVIDENT FOR CROP TARGETS. THE LOWEST BACKSCATTER VALUES FOR ALL CLASSES WERE FOUND DURING THE DRY SNOWCOVER PERIOD. FOREST AND PASTURE CLASSES EXHIBITED THE LEAST WITHIN SCENE VARIANCE. THE ANALYSIS HAS SHOWN THAT MULTITEMPORAL SATELLITE SAR HOLDS PROMISE FOR MONITORING HYDROLOGIC/ENVIRONMENTAL PARAMETERS.
C1: INTERA INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES, NEPEAN, CANADA

column1: CARL S, 1994, PROC SPIE INT SOC OPT ENG
AU: CARL, S; KRAFT, R
CR: NA
AB: AGRICULTURAL CROP MONITORING BY REMOTE SENSING TECHNIQUES BENEFITS FROM THE AVAILABILITY OF WEATHER INDEPENDENT DATA LIKE ERS-1.SAR.PRI SCENES. SIGNATURE BASED TRADITIONAL AGRICULTURAL LANDUSE CLASSIFICATION METHODS CAN ONLY BE PERFORMED ON HEAVILY FILTERED RADAR DATA DUE TO APPARENT SPECKLE NOISE. HOWEVER, THE SPECKLE CONTAINS TEXTURAL INFORMATION ON THE ILLUMINATED AREA. THUS A PROCESSING PIPELINE FOR A TEXTURE BASED CLASSIFICATION APPROACH OF UNFILTERED ERS- 1.SAR.PRI DATA WAS DEVELOPED USING TWO DIFFERENT KINDS OF NEURAL NETWORKS. A KOHONEN MAP IS USED TO VISUALIZE THE TEXTURAL FEATURES AND TO DEFINE PROPER TRAINING AREAS FOR A SUBSEQUENT SUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION WITH A BACKPROPAGATION NET. THE PIPELINE WAS APPLIED TO MONO- AND MULTITEMPORAL ERS-1 SCENES OF A SITE NEAR PRENZLAU IN BRANDENBURG, GERMANY. FIRST RESULTS ARE ENCOURAGING AND DEMONSTRATE THE POSSIBILITY TO DISCRIMINATE SEVERAL LANDUSE TYPES. THE RECLASSIFICATION ERROR OF THE TRAINING SAMPLES WAS LESS THAN 5%. ENTIRE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS CORRESPOND TO THE GROUND TRUTH DATA QUITE WELL. THE MAIN ADVANTAGE OF THE PROCESSING PIPELINE IS THAT BOTH SIGNATURE AND TEXTURE FEATURES OF THE UNFILTERED IMAGE ARE USED TO DISTINGUISH BETWEEN DIFFERENT CLASSES.
C1: TECHNISCHE UNIV. MUENCHEN, FREISING, GER
DE: NA

AB: WE HAVE EXAMINED THE CONTRIBUTION OF MULTIPOLARIZED AIRBORNE RADAR DATA FOR THE DISCRIMINATION OF CROPS. AN UNSUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION ALGORITHM AND A MAXIMUM LIKELIHOOD SUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION WERE USED AND COMPARED. THE RESULTS SHOW THAT MULTIPOLARIZED RADAR DATA OFFER AN ACCURATE MEANS OF IDENTIFYING CROPS. THE AVERAGE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES WERE 83 AND 79 PER CENT FOR THE SUPERVISED AND UNSUPERVISED METHODS RESPECTIVELY. COMPARISON OF THE TWO METHODS USING THE SAME DATA SUGGESTS THAT THE UNSUPERVISED METHOD GIVES ESSENTIALLY SIMILAR RESULTS TO THOSE USING THE SUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION METHOD; HOWEVER, THE UNSUPERVISED METHOD REQUIRES FAR LESS FIELD EFFORT AND COMPUTER TIME.  1994 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

AB: WE DESCRIBE AN APPLICATION OF SCALE-SPACE CLUSTERING TO THE CLASSIFICATION OF A MULTISPECTRAL AND POLARIMETRIC SAR IMAGE OF AN AGRICULTURAL SITE. AFTER POLARIMETRIC AND RADIOMETRIC CALIBRATION AND NOISE CANCELLATION, WE EXTRACTED A 12-DIMENSIONAL FEATURE VECTOR FOR EACH PIXEL FROM THE SCATTERING MATRIX. THE ALGORITHM WAS ABLE TO PARTITION WITHOUT SUPERVISION A SET OF UNLABELED VECTORS FROM 13 SELECTED SITES, EACH SITE CORRESPONDING TO A DISTINCT CROP, INTO 13 CLUSTERS. THE CLUSTER PARAMETERS WERE THEN USED TO CLASSIFY THE WHOLE IMAGE. THE CLASSIFICATION MAP IS MUCH LESS NOISY AND MORE ACCURATE THAN THOSE OBTAINED BY HIERARCHICAL RULES. THE ALGORITHM CAN HANDLE VARIABILITIES IN CLUSTER DENSITIES, CLUSTER SIZES AND ELLIPSOIDAL SHAPES.  1992 IEEE.

column1: HOEKMAN DH, 1992, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: HOEKMAN, D; VAN, D, S, J; RIJCKENBERG, G
CR: NA
AB: IN AUGUST 1989 THE NASA/JPL MULTIBAND (P,L,C) POLARIMETRIC SAR ACQUIRED DATA OVER THE FLEVOLAND/NELUWE TEST SITE IN THE NETHERLANDS. DURING THE COMMISSIONING PHASE OF ERS-1 THIS TEST AREA HAS BEEN OBSERVED EVERY THREE DAYS BY THE SAR. TREES, AS OPPOSED TO AGRICULTURAL CROPS, EXHIBIT SOME CHARACTERISTIC POLARIMETRIC BACKSCATTERING PROPERTIES. THESE MAY BE CAUSED BY THE BRANCH STRUCTURE AND BRANCH ORIENTATION AS WELL AS BY THE TRUNK -GROUND INTERACTION. EMPIRICAL RELATIONS BETWEEN POLARIMETRIC DATA AND FOREST CHARACTERISTICS, COVERING A WIDE RANGE OF SPECIES, WILL BE PRESENTED IN A SYSTEMATIC WAY. THESE INCLUDE RESULTS OF POLARIMETRIC CLASSIFICATION OF FOREST STANDS USING MAXIMUM CONTRASTS, CLASSIFICATION OF SCATTERING BEHAVIOUR, DEGREE OF POLARIZATION, THE HH-VV PHASE DIFFERENCE AND RELATIONS BETWEEN RADAR BACKSCATTER PROPERTIES AND FOREST BIOMASS AND FOREST SOIL MOISTURE CONTENT. A SIMULATION OF THE TEMPORAL BEHAVIOUR OF ERSL SAR BACKSCATTER FOR A POPLAR STAND WILL BE DISCUSSED.  IEEE 1992.

AB: THE SIMILARITIES AND DIFFERENCES BETWEEN IMAGERY ACQUIRED AT X-, C-AND L-BANDS ARE EXAMINED BY CALCULATING THE CORRELATIONS BETWEEN X-, C-, AND L-BAND SAR DATA ACQUIRED OVER AN AGRICULTURAL AREA NEAR MEIFORT, SASKATCHEWAN IN WESTERN CANADA WITH THE CCRS SAR-580. THE SAR DATA WERE ACQUIRED ON TWO SEPARATE OCCASIONS DURING THE GROWING SEASON (JULY AND AUGUST, 1983) WITH VERTICAL POLARIZATION IN BOTH TRANSMIT AND RECEIVE. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CORRELATIONS BETWEEN THE C-AND L-BAND AND BETWEEN X-AND L-BAND DATA WERE VERY LOW INDICATING THAL THE RADAR BACKSCATTER AT THE DIFFERENT FREQUENCIES IS CAUSED BY DIFFERENT MECHANISMS. THE CORRELATION BETWEEN X-AND C-BAND DATA WAS LOW FOR GRAINS, WHICH HAVE A WELL DEFINED VERTICAL STRUCTURE. FOR CANOLA AND FIELD PEAS, WHICH ARE BOTH BROADLEAVED PLANTS WITH LITTLE DEFINITE STRUCTURE, I HERE WAS A HIGHER CORRELATION BETWEEN THE MEASURED BACKSCATTER VALUES. FOR L-BAND DATA THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE RADAR BACKSCATTER IS PROBABLY FROM THE UNDERLYING SOIL AND THUS LARGELY INFLUENCED BY SOIL PROPERTIES. FOR THE C-BAND AND X-BAND DATA, THE VEGETATION PARAMETERS ARE PROBABLY THE PREDOMINANT FACTORS, PARTICULARLY FOR THE JULY DATA SET. AS AN ADDITIONAL EVALUATION OF THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE DATA AT THESE THREE FREQUENCIES, THE IMAGERY WAS CLASSIFIED AND THE PIXEL CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES FOR EACH BAND WERE COMPARED. IT WAS FOUND THAT FOR A FOUR-CLASS CLASSIFICATION, TAKEN ONE BAND AT A TIME, THAT SIMILAR CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES WERE OBTAINED WITH THE X-AND C-BAND DATA (WITH THE C-BAND BEING SLIGHTLY BETTER) BUT THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES FOR THE L-BAND DATA WERE CONSIDERABLY LOWER. THIS ANALYSIS SUPPORTS THE PREVIOUS CONCLUSION THAT CROP TYPE (VEGETATION COVER) IS THE DOMINANT GEOPHYSICAL PARAMETER DRIVING THE RADAR BACKSCATTER AT X-AND C-BANDS, BUT NOT AT L-BAND.  1992 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

AU: PEDERSEN, J; JOHNSEN, H; GUNERIUSSEN, T; JOHANSEN, B; ROSENGREN, M
CR: NA
AB: VEGETATION CLASSIFICATION RESULTS WHICH USE C-BAND POLARIMETRIC SAR DATA COMBINED WITH LANDSAT/THEMATIC MAPPER (TM) DATA ACQUIRED OVER AGRICULTURAL AREAS ARE PRESENTED. THE DATA WERE ACQUIRED DURING THE MAESTRO CAMPAIGN. THE AUTHORS CALIBRATED THE C-BAND SAR DATA FROM THE FELTWELL TEST AREA USING THE JPL-DEVELOPED CALIBRATION SOFTWARE. THEY PRESENT RESULTS FROM CLASSIFICATION USING TM DATA ONLY AND DEMONSTRATE THE IMPROVED CLASSIFICATION CAPABILITIES WHEN THE C-BAND HH, VV AND HV SYNTHESIZED IMAGES ARE USED TOGETHER WITH THE TM DATA. COMPARISON OF SAR CO- AND CROSS-POLARIZATION SIGNATURES FOR THE MAIN CROP TYPES WITHIN THE TEST AREA HAVE SO FAR GIVEN NO EVIDENCE OF UNIQUE, SEPARABLE CROP RESPONSES.

AB: TYPICALITIES OF CLASS MEMBERSHIP GENERATED FROM A MAXIMUM LIKELIHOOD CLASSIFICATION MAY BE USED TO INCREASE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY BY THE MODIFICATION OF CLASS ALLOCATION ON THE BASIS OF ADDITIONAL GROUND SURVEYS. WHILST THIS INCREASES THE AMOUNT OF GROUND SURVEY REQUIRED THE ADDITIONAL SURVEY EFFORT IS DIRECTED TO REGIONS WHERE THERE IS POTENTIAL MISCLASSIFICATION. DIRECTING SURVEYS TO THOSE CASES WHICH DISPLAYED, FOR INSTANCE, A TYPICALITY OF LESS THAN 0-05 TO THEIR MOST LIKELY CLASS OF MEMBERSHIP INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY THE ACCURACY OF A CROP CLASSIFIC-ATION WITH SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR DATA BY 11-70 PER CENT TO 77-27 PER CENT.  1990 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

column1: THOMSON KPB, 1989, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: THOMSON, K; LANDRY, R; EDWARDS, G; CANTIN, M; GWYN, H
CR: NA
AB: DURING THE SUMMER OF 1988, C AND X BAND SAR DATA WERE OBTAINED OVER AN AGRICULTURAL TEST SITE IN QUEBEC. THE STUDY AREA IS SITUATED IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF SAINT-LEONARD D'ASTRON ON THE SOUTH SHORE OF THE ST. LAURENCE RIVER. THE SAR DATA WERE ACQUIRED AT FOUR TIMES DURING THE GROWING SEASON (MAY 16, JUNE 6, JULY 15 AND AUGUST 4). THE SITE WAS IMAGED FROM THREE DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS ON EACH DATA. ONE DIRECTION WAS PERPENDICULAR TO THE FIELD DIRECTION. A SECOND DIRECTION WAS FLOWN PARALLEL AND A THIRD WAS APPROXIMATELY 45 TO THE FIELD DIRECTION. DATA ON THE VARIOUS CROPS WERE ALSO ACQUIRED DURING EACH OVERFLIGHT. THE SAR DATA FOR JULY, AT TWO ILLUMINATION ANGLES, HAVE BEEN REGISTERED TO A MAP BASE AND CLASSIFIED. THE AGRICULTURAL DATA, THE CARTOGRAPHIC INFORMATION AND THE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS HAVE INTEGRATED INTO A PAMAP GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION SYSTEM. THE PRELIMINARY RESULTS SHOW THAT THE ILLUMINATION DIRECTION IS IMPORTANT FOR CERTAIN CROPS. THIS EFFECT CAN ALSO INFLUENCE THE OVERALL CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY. THE HIGHEST OVERALL CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY WAS OBTAINED WITH THE X BAND DATA.

AB: THIS PAPER PRESENTS AN APPROACH TO THE CLASSIFICATION OF CROP TYPE USING MULTI-TEMPORAL AIRBORNE SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) DATA. FOLLOWING RADIOMETRIC CORRECTION OF THE DATA THE ACCURACY OF A PER-FIELD CROP CLASSIFICATION REACHED 90% FOR THREE CLASSES USING DATA ACQUIRED ON FOUR DATES. A COMPARABLE ACCURACY OF 88% COULD BE OBTAINED FOR A CLASSIFICATION OF THE SAME CLASSES USING DATA ACQUIRED ON ONLY TWO DATES. INCREASING THE NUMBER OF CLASSES FROM THREE TO SEVEN REDUCED THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES TO 55% AND 69% WHEN USING DATA FROM TWO AND FOUR DATES RESPECTIVELY.  1989 TAYLOR & FRANCIS, LTD.

column1: FIUMARA A, 1988, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP (IGARSS)
AU: FIUMARA, A; PIERDICCA, N; RICOTTILLI, M
CR: NA
AB: THE UTILITY OF MULTIDATE AND MULTIPOLARIZATION SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) DATA FOR AGRICULTURAL CROP CLASSIFICATION IS ASSESSED. DIVERGENCE AS A SEPARABILITY INDEX IS USED OVER X-BAND SAR AIRBORNE DATA TO IDENTIFY CLASS PAIRS THAT HAVE POOR SEPARABILITY AND TO SINGLE OUT THE SET OF CHANNELS THAT WILL PRODUCE ACCEPTABLE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS. SPECIFICALLY, AN ANALYSIS WAS PERFORMED ON THE AGRISAR '86 CAMPAIGN DATA (X-BAND, MULTIPOLARIZATION AND MULTITEMPORAL SAR IMAGES). THE ANALYSIS SHOWED THAT THE BEST RESULTS IN CLASSIFYING TYPICAL ITALIAN CROPS BY X-BAND RADAR CAN BE OBTAINED BY MULTITEMPORAL OBSERVATION AT VV POLARIZATION. THE PER FIELD CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY IS REPRESENTED BY A VALUE OF THE K COEFFICIENT RANGING FROM 0.65 TO 0.80.

AU: FOODY, G; CURRAN, P; GROOM, G; MUNRO, D
CR: NA
AB: MULTITEMPORAL X-BAND HH-POLARIZED SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) DATA WERE USED TO CLASSIFY CROP TYPE. PRIOR TO THE CLASSIFICATION, THE INFLUENCE OF NONCROP VARIABLES ON CROP SEPARABILITY WERE EVALUATED. WHILE THE INFLUENCE OF THE SOIL MOISTURE CONTENT WAS UNIMPORTANT, THE DATA SETS HAD TO BE RADIOMETRICALLY CORRECTED AND INTERCALIBRATED. A PREFIELD CLASSIFICATION OF THESE DATA ENABLED THE THREE MAIN CROP TYPES OF THE TEST SITE TO BE CLASSIFIED WITH ACCURACIES APPROACHING 90% WHEN THE COMPLETE MULTITEMPORAL DATA SET ACQUIRED ON FOUR DATES WAS USED. IT WAS FOUND THAT COMPARABLE LEVELS OF ACCURACY COULD BE OBTAINED FROM THE USE OF DATA RECORDED ON ONLY TWO OF THE FOUR DATES.

AB: IN THIS PAPER WE SUMMARIZE THE RESULTS OF INVESTIGATIONS CARRIED OUT ON VEGETATION IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS USING ACTIVE AND PASSIVE X BAND SENSORS. THESE RESULTS SHOW THAT, ALTHOUGH THE SENSITIVITY OF PASSIVE SYSTEMS TO DIFFERENT TYPES OF VEGETATION IS RATHER LOW, CROP CLASSIFICATION BY MEANS OF X BAND RADAR HAS PROMISING APPLICATIONS. MOREOVER, THE MEASUREMENTS HAVE SHOWN THAT VERY SENSITIVE RADIOMETERS CAN DETECT PLANT MOISTURE AND A RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN PLANT WATER CONTENT AND THE OPTICAL DEPTH HAS BEEN FOUND USING A MODEL BASED ON RADIATIVE TRANSFER THEORY. FINALLY, THE BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENTS OF CERTAIN CROPS HAVE BEEN COMPUTED FROM RADIOMETRIC DATA THROUGH A MODEL DEVELOPED BY TSANG.  1987.

AB: IL A T DMONTR QUE LA TEXTURE TAIT UNE CARACTRISTIQUE D'IMAGE IMPORTANTE DANS LES APPLICATIONS RELIES  LA FORESTERIE ET  TUTILISATION DU SOL. DANS LE PRSENT ARTICLE, LES AUTEURS VALUENT LE ROLE DE LA TEXTURE D'IMAGE DANS LA CLASSIFICATION DE CIBLES AGRICOLES SUR I'IMAGERIE RAS. L'APPLICATION DE LA TEXTURE D'IMAGE  L'ANALYSE NUMERIQUE DE DONNES DE TLDTECTION REQUIERT UNE DFINITION QUANTITATIVE DE LA TEXTURE. A CET EFFET, DES TRANSFORMEES TEXTURALES S'APPUYANT SUR DES MESURES DISCRTES DE CHAQUE PIXEL ONT T PRODUITES. CETTE TECHNIQUE SE FONDE SUR LA CONDENSATION DE LA DISTRIBUTION DES NIVEAUX DE GRIS AUTOUR DE CHAQUE PIXEL, CE QUI DEFINIT LA TEXTURE, PAR LA MESURE DE COOCCURRENCE DE SES NIVEAUX DE GRIS. DES TRANSFORMES TEXTURALES D'UNE IMAGE RAS-580 DE MELFORT, EN SASKATCHEWAN, ONT ETE PRODUITES EN VUE DE TESTER LA FONCTION DE PROBABILIT DES COOCCURRENCES DE NIVEAUX DE GRIS POUR TROIS TYPES DE CULTURE: LE CANOLA, LES CRALES ET LA JACHRE. D'AUTRE PART, LES AUTEURS ONT ANALYSE L'INFLUENCE DE DIFFRENTS AZIMUTS DE VOL SUR LA CLASSIFICATION TEXTURALE  PARTIR DE DONNES STAR-1 (INTERA TECHNOLOGIES LTD.) DE SWIFT CURRENT, EN SASKATCHEWAN, ACQUISES  TROIS AZIMUTS DE VOL DIFFRENTS. DES TRANSFORMES ONT T CRES  PARTIR DE MESURES DES PROPRITS LOCALES  I'INTRIEUR DE FENETRES DE CINQ PIXELS SUR CINQ ENTOURANT CHAQUE PIXEL. LES MESURES QUI ONT T EMPLOYEES POUR EXTRAIRE LES RENSEIGNEMENTS  CARACTERE TEXTURAL DES MATRICES DE COOCCURRENCE SONT LES SUIVANTES: CONTRASTE, CORRELATION, DISSEMBLANCE, MOYENNE ET ECART TYPE. DES CLASSIFICATIONS NUMERIQUES ONT ETE RALISES SUR I'IMAGE INITIALE A QUATRE VISES, SUR LES TRANSFORMES TEXTURALES ET SUR LES DONNES FILTRES SPATIALEMENT. LA SLECTION DES PARAMTRES CARACTRISANT LES IMAGES  ETEFAITE DE MANIRE  OBTENIR DES RENSEIGNEMENTS SUR 1'IMPORTANCE RELATIVE DES TRANSFORMES TEXTURALES COMPARATIVE-MENT AUX IMAGES DE RTRODIFFUSION RADAR. LES RSULTATS INDIQUENT, D'UNE PART, QUE LA PRCISION DE LA CLASSIFICATION RALISE A I'AIDE DES TRANSFORMEES TEXTURALES EST ANALOGUE  CELLE OBTENUE A PARTIR DES IMAGES DE RETRODIFFUSION RADAR ET, D'AUTRE PART, QUE CES TRANSFORMEES ONT UN RLE CERTAIN DANS I'ANALYSE DE DONNES RAS. COMME CETTE TUDE N 'EST QU 'UNE TUDE PRLIMINAIRE, LES PARAMTRES UTILISS POUR PRODUIRE LES TRANSFORMES TEXTURALES N'ONT PAS ETE OPTIMISS. PAR CONSEQUENT, IL SE PEUT QUE LES RESULTATS NE RFLTENT PAS LE POTENTIEL REL DES TRANSFORMES TEXTURALES DE I'IMAGERIE RAS POUR LA CLASSIFICATION DES CULTURES. TEXTURE HAS BEEN SHOWN TO BE AN IMPORTANT IMAGE FEATURE IN LAND-USE AND FORESTRY APPLICATIONS. THIS PAPER EVALUATES THE ROLE OF IMAGE TEXTURE FOR SAR IMAGE CLASSIFICATION OF AGRICULTURAL TARGETS. THE APPLICATION OF IMAGE TEXTURE TO THE DIGITAL ANALYSIS OF REMOTELY SENSED DATA REQUIRES A QUANTITATIVE CHARACTERIZATION OF TEXTURE. THE APPROACH TO TEXTURE ANALYSIS USED IN THIS STUDY WAS THE CONSTRUCTION OF TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS CONSISTING OF DISCRETE MEASURES FOR EACH PIXEL. THIS TECHNIQUE DESCRIBES THE GREY LEVEL DISTRIBUTIONS AROUND EACH PIXEL WHICH CHARACTERIZES TEXTURE BY THE CO-OCCURRENCE OF ITS GREY TONES. TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS OFSAR-580 IMAGERY OF MELFORT, SASKATCHEWAN WERE GENERATED TO TEST THE SPATIAL GREY-TONE CO-OCCURRENCE PROBABILITY FUNCTION OF THREE FIELD TYPES: CANOLA, GRAINS, AND FALLOW. SECONDLY, THE INFLUENCE OF DIFFERENT FLIGHT AZIMUTHS ON THE TEXTURE CLASSIFICATION WAS INVESTIGATED USING INTERA TECHNOLOGIES LTD, STAR-1 DATA OF SWIFT CURRENT, SASKATCHEWAN ACQUIRED AT THREE DIFFERENT FLIGHT AZIMUTHS. TRANSFORMS WERE DERIVED FROM LOCAL PROPERTIES WITHIN FIVE-BY-FIVE PIXEL WINDOWS SURROUNDING EACH PIXEL. MEASURES EMPLOYED TO EXTRACT TEXTURAL INFORMATION FROM THE CO-CURRENCE MATRICES INCLUDED: CONTRAST, CORRELATION, DISSIMILARITY, MEAN, AND STANDARD DEVIATION. DIGITAL CLASSIFICATIONS WERE PERFORMED ON THE ORIGINAL FOUR-LOOK IMAGE, TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS OF THE DATA, AND SPATIALLY FILTERED DATA. FEATURE SELECTION WAS PERFORMED TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON THE RELATIVE IMPORTANCE OF THE TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS AS COMPARED TO THE IMAGES OF RADAR BACKSCATTER. THE RESULTS INDICATE THAT CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY USING TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS WERE SIMILAR TO THAT OF RADAR BACKSCATTER IMAGES AND THAT THESE TRANSFORMS HAVE A ROLE IN SAR ANALYSIS. DUE TO THE PRELIMINARY NATURE OF THIS STUDY PARAMETERS FOR THE GENERATION OF THE TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS WERE NOT OPTIMIZED. THEREFORE, THE RESULTS MAY NOT REFLECT THE FULL POTENTIAL OF TEXTURAL TRANSFORMS OF SAR IMAGERY FOR CROP CLASSIFICATION.  1987 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

AB: THIS STUDY COMPARES SEVERAL FILTERING TECHNIQUES TO IMPROVE THE CLASSIFICATION OF A SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) IMAGE. WITH THIS AIM IN VIEW, WE SEPARATE THEMATIC INFORMATION AND NOISE BY SPECKLE ANALYSIS, AND WE PROPOSE FILTERS ADAPTED TO SPECKLE MODELS. THE EVALUATION INCLUDES A BRIEF THEORETICAL ANALYSIS, A VISUAL INTERPRETATION, A SIGNAL-TO-NOISE RATIO ANALYSIS, A COMPARISON OF REQUIRED COMPUTER TIMES, AS WELL AS CLASSIFICATION RESULTS. THE STUDY ALSO SHOWS THE EFFECT OF ACTIVE MICROWAVES ON CROP IDENTIFICATION IN THE CASE WHERE THERE IS A ONE-DATE ONE-LOOK SAR IMAGE, THE UTILIZATION OF X- AND C-BANDS, AND HH POLARIZATION. COPYRIGHT  1987 BY THE INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONICS ENGINEERS, INC.

AB: TWO PRE-DAWN ASCENDING DATA-TAKES (DT. 49.2 AND 97.2) BY THE SHUTTLE IMAGING RADAR (SIRB) ARE USED TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTS OF SOIL MOISTURE, SURFACE ROUGHNESS, AND CROP CANOPY COVER ON RADAR BACKSCATTERING. THE TWO IMAGES ARE SEPARATED IN ACQUISITION DATE BY THREE DAYS AND WERE OBTAINED AT THE SAME LOCAL ANGLE OF INCIDENCE (TT= 300) BUT WITH OPPOSITE AZIMUTH VIEWING DIRECTIONS (<U+0394><U+0391>=1800). THE DIGITALLY RECORDED AND PROCESSED SIRB IMAGERY IS EXTERNALLY CALIBRATED WITH RESPECT TO THE RADAR BACKSCATTERING COEFFICIENT S VIA RESPONSE TO ARRAYS OF POINT AND AREA-EXTENDED TARGETS OF KNOWN RADAR CROSS SECTION. EXTENSIVE ANCILLARY DATA PERTAINING TO SCENE PHYSICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL CONDITIONS WERE COLLECTED FROM APPROXIMATELY 400 AGRICULTURAL FIELDS WITHIN A 20 KM  20 KM TEST SITE IN WEST-CENTRAL ILLINOIS. THE TEST SITE WAS LARGELY AGRICULTURAL AND CONSISTED PRIMARILY OF CORN AND SOYBEANS AT HARVEST-READY CONDITIONS. FOR THE AGRICULTURAL PORTIONS OF THE SCENE, SSIRBIS FOUND TO VARY OVER A 16- TO 20-DB DYNAMIC RANGE FOR A GIVEN OBSERVATION DATE. THE MAGNITUDE OF SSIRBIS FOUND TO BE PROPORTIONAL TO SOIL MOISTURE, SURFACE ROUGHNESS, AND CANOPY BIOMASS. ALTHOUGH THE SIRB SENSOR PARAMETERS (L-BAND, HH POLARIZATION, AND T= 300) WERE NOT EXPECTED TO BE OPTIMUM FOR ESTIMATION OF NEAR-SURFACE SOIL MOISTURE, SIGNIFICANT LINEAR CORRELATIONS ARE OBSERVED BETWEEN SSIRB (IN DECIBELS) AND 0-5-CM VOLUMETRIC MOISTURE MU. FOR A GIVEN TARGET CLASS AS BROADLY DEFINED BY SURFACE ROUGHNESS AND CANOPY COVER, LINEAR REGRESSION OF SSIRB(DB) TO MU GENERALLY YIELDS CORRELATION COEFFICIENTS OF R2 ~ 0.8. AS EXPECTED FROM ANTECEDENT SCATTEROMETER STUDIES, SSIRB IS FOUND TO BE STRONGLY DEPENDENT UPON SURFACE ROUGHNESS AND CROP CANOPY COVER. THE COMBINED EFFECTS OF ROUGHNESS AND CANOPY COVER ARE READILY PREDICTED BY THREE COMPONENT SCATTERING MODELS WHICH CONSIDER SURFACE SCATTER, VOLUME SCATTER IN THE CANOPY, AND SURFACE/CANOPY INTERACTION. FOR SOYBEANS, ALFALFA, AND CLOVER, THE RANDOM DISTRIBUTION AND ORIENTATIONS OF CANOPY ELEMENTS PERMIT TREATMENT OF THE CANOPY VIA THE CLOUD MODEL WITH BACKSCATTERING FROM THE SOIL AS THE DOMINANT TERM. FOR CORN, THE SURFACE/CANOPY INTERACTION TERM IS DOMINANT AND IS FELT TO BE RELATED TO THE HIGH EFFECTIVE REFLECTIVITY OF THE STALKS WHICH CONTAIN 50 PERCENT OF THE TOTAL PLANT WATER CONTENT. IN ADDITION, THE EFFECTIVE REFLECTIVITY OF THE STALKS IS APPARENTLY PROPORTIONAL TO THE STALK WATER DENSITY ON A PER FIELD BASIS. SIGNIFICANTLY, THE BETWEEN CLASS DIFFERENCE IN SSIRBIS FOUND TO BE GREAT ENOUGH TO PERMIT LIMITED LAND-COVER CLASSIFICATION USING THE SSIRB DATA ALONE. WHILE IMPORTANT IN AND OF ITSELF, THIS CAPABILITY (IF NOT HEURISTIC) ENHANCES THE PROSPECTS FOR SOIL MOISTURE RETRIEVAL SINCE THE EMPIRICAL RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS ARE FOUND TO BE CLASS SPECIFIC. THIS SUGGESTS A POSSIBLE RETRIEVAL APPROACH WHEREIN THE SCENE IS AUTO-CLASSIFIED FROM THE SAR IMAGE AND THEN SUBJECTED TO CLASS-SPECIFIC RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS. SINCE MOISTURE SENSITIVITY <U+0394>S0/<U+0394>MU IS FOUND TO BE RELATIVELY INDEPENDENT OF TARGET CLASS, AN ALTERNATIVE APPROACH WOULD BE TO APPLY MULTITEMPORAL CHANGE DETECTION TO UPDATE ESTIMATES OF NEAR-SURFACE SOIL MOISTURE. COPYRIGHT  1986 BY THE INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONICS ENGINEERS, INC.

AB: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PAPER IS TO REVIEW CURRENT KNOWLEDGE CONCERNING SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR APPLICATIONS TO CROPS IN CANADA. FOLLOWING A BRIEF OVERVIEW OF STUDIES DURING SURSAT (1978-1980) AND RADARSAT (1981 AND LATER) PROJECTS, SEVERAL ISSUES ARE CONSIDERED. THESE INCLUDE CROP-CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES ACHIEVED WITH SAR OR SAR AND VIR DATA AT VARIOUS SITES, THE IMPORTANCE OF CROP AND SOIL PARAMETERS AFFECTING SAR IMAGES, THE PROCEDURES FOR DIGITAL SAR IMAGE ANALYSIS AND THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN AIRBORNE SAR DATA AND FUTURE SATELLITE SAR DATA. FINALLY, RECENT DEVELOPMENTS OF NEW GROUND AND AIRBORNE MICROWAVE INSTRUMENTS TO BE USED IN AGRICULTURAL STUDIES ARE DESCRIBED.  1986 TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP, LLC.

AU: GUINDON, B; TEILLET, P; GOODENOUGH, D; PALIMAKA, J; SIEBER, A

AB: A JOINT STUDY WITH THE GERMAN AEROSPACE RESEARCH ESTABLISHMENT HAS BEEN CARRIED OUT AT THE CANADA CENTRE FOR REMOTE SENSING TO EVALUATE X, L AND C-BAND SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) IMAGERY FOR CROP INVENTORY APPLICATIONS. AIRBORNE SAR AND MULTISPECTRAL SCANNER (MSS) DATA WERE ACQUIRED OVER A TEST SITE NEAR STRAUBING, FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY, DURING THE EUROPEAN SAR 580 CAMPAIGN OF 1981. ALL IMAGES WERE FIRST RADIOMETRICALLY CORRECTED USING AN EMPIRICAL SCENE-SPECIFIC PROFILING TECHNIQUE. INTEGRATED MULTIPASS, MULTISENSOR DATA SETS WERE GENERATED BY MAP RECTIFYING DATA USING A FLIGHT LINE MODELLING TECHNIQUE (GUINDON ET AL, 1982). AVERAGE REGISTERED ACCURACIES OF 7 METRES EAST-WEST AND NORTH-SOUTH WERE ACHIEVED. EVALUATIONS WERE MADE OF THE CLASSIFICATION PERFORMANCE OF A VARIETY OF 10 AND 20 METRE RESOLUTION DATA SETS. CLASS SETS CONSISTED OF THE MAJOR CROP TYPES OF THE STRAUBING AREA (I.E. SUGAR BEETS, POTATOES, WINTER WHEAT, WINTER BARLEY AND OATS). MULTICHANNEL MSS AND SAR COMBINATIONS WERE FOUND TO PROVIDE AVERAGE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES IN EXCESS OF 90VO. THE PERFORMANCE OF SINGLE SAR FEATURES TENDED TO BE SIGNIFICANTLY POORER. IN GENERAL X-BAND DATA OUTPERFORMED BOTH L AND C-BAND SINGLE FEATURES. QUANTITATIVE ANALYSES WERE UNDERTAKEN TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTS OF MEDIAN FILTERING ON CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY. IN ADDITION, COMPARISONS WERE MADE OF THE PERFORMANCE OF OPTICAL VERSUS DIGITALLY PROCESSED SCENES AND OF THE DEGRADATION IN ACCURACY INCURRED WHEN FULL FIELD SEGMENTS ARE USED TO ACQUIRE TRAINING STATISTICS PRIOR TO CLASSIFICATION.  1984 CANADIAN SPACE AGENCY.

AB: DURING JUNE AND JULY 1981, SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR IMAGERY WAS ACQUIRED OF SELECTED SITES IN TEN EUROPEAN COUNTRIES AS PART OF THE EUROPEAN SAR 580 CAMPAIGN. EVALUATION OF THIS IMAGERY IN THE UK WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY 18 APPROVED EXPERIMENTS (OUT OF 56 FOR EUROPE) WHEN THE PROCESSED DATA BECOMES AVAILABLE TO INVESTIGATORS. TO ASSIST THE EVALUATION PROCESS, A REVIEW IS GIVEN OF SOME RECENT RESEARCH ON APPLICATIONS OF IMAGING RADAR IN AGRICULTURAL AND URBAN AREAS. RESEARCH IS DESCRIBED WHICH CONSIDERED THE EFFECTS OF TERRAIN PARAMETERS AND RADAR PARAMETERS ON CROP CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY. THE RELATIVE MERITS OF A QUANTITATIVE OR A QUALITATIVE APPROACH IN CLASSIFICATION OF RADAR DATA ARE CONSIDERED. COMBINED USE OF RADAR AND LANDSAT DATA ACHIEVES A MARKED IMPROVEMENT IN CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY. THE DEVELOPMENT OF SPATIAL FILTERING TECHNIQUES MAY ASSIST IN THE PROBLEM IN URBAN AREAS RESULTING FROM THE DEPENDENCE OF IMAGE TONE ON THE RELATIVE ALIGNMENT OF GROUND FEATURES AND RADAR LOOK DIRECTION. PENDANT LES MOIS DEJUIN ET JUILLET 1981, ON A, DANS LE CADRE DE LA CAMPAGNE EUROPENNE SAR 580, RECUEILLI DES DONNES DE RADAR IMAGEUR  SYNTHSE D'OUVERTURE SUR DES SITES CHOISIS DANS UNE DIZAINE DE PAYS D'EUROPE. CES DONNES SERONT VALUES AU ROYAUME-UNI AU MOYEN DE 18 EXPRIENCES AYANT T ACCEPTES (SUR UN TOTAL DE 56 MENES EN EUROPE); CE TRAVAIL COMMENCERA DS QUE LES DONNES UNE FOIS TRAITES SERONT DISTRIBUES AUX CHERCHEURS. POUR ACCOMPAGNER CETTE PROCDURE D'EVALUATION, ON FOURNIT UNE ANALYSE DE QUELQUES RECHERCHES RCENTES SUR LES APPLICATIONS DE L'IMAGERIE RADAR AUX ZONES AGRICOLES ET URBAINES. L'UNE DE CES RECHERCHES PRENAIT EN COMPTE LES EFFETS DES PARAMTRES LIS AU TERRAIN SUR L'EXACTITUDE DE LA CLASSIFICATION DES CULTURES. LES MRITES RCIPROQUES DES APPROCHES QUANTITATIVES ET QUALITATIVES DANS LA CLASSIFICATION DES DONNES RADAR SONT GALEMENT EXAMINS. LE RECOURS  UNE COMBINAISON DE DONNES RADAR ET LANDSAT PERMET D'AMLIORER DE MANIRE SIGNIFICATIVE L'EXACTITUDE DE LA CLASSIFICATION. LA MISE EN OEUVRE DES TECHNIQUES DE FILTRAGE SPATIAL PEUT AIDER  RDUIRE, DANS LES ZONES URBAINES, LES CONSQUENCES NFASTES SUR LA TONALIT DE L'IMAGE, D'OBJETS AU SOL EN ALIGNEMENT RELATIF AVEC LA DIRECTION D'OBSERVATION DU RADAR. IM JUNI UND JULI 1981 ERFOLGTEN RADARAUFNAHMEN MITTELS SYNTHETISCHER APERTUR VON AUSGEWHLTEN GEBIETEN IN 10 EUROPISCHEN LNDERN ALS TEIL DER EUROPISCHEN SAR 580 KAMPAGNE. DIE ANALYSE DIESER AUFZEICHNUNGEN WIRD IM VEREINIGTEN KNIGREICH DURCH 18 (AUS INSGESAMT 56 FR EUROPA) BESTTIGTE EXPERIMENTE ERFOLGEN, NACHDEM DIE DATEN ZUR VERFGUNG STEHEN. UM DEN ANALYSENPROZESS ZU UNTERSTTZEN, WIRD EIN BERBLICK BER KRZLICHE FORSCHUNGEN ZU RADARAUFZEICHNUNGEN IN LANDWIRTSCHAFTLICHEN UND STDTISCHEN GEBIETEN GEGEBEN. ES WERDEN AUCH FORSCHUNGEN BESCHRIEBEN, BEI DENEN DIE EINFLSSE VON GELNDEPARAMETERN AUF DIE GENAUIGKEIT DER ERNTEKLASSIFIZIERUNG UNTERSUCHT WURDEN. DER RELATIVE WERT EINES QUANTITATIVEN ODER QUALITATIVEN VERSUCHS ZUR KLASSIFIZIERUNG VON RADARDATEN WIRD ABGESCHTZT. EINE KOMBINATION VON RADARUND LANDSAT-DATEN ERGIBT EINE MERKLICHE VERBESSERUNG BEI KLASSIFIZIERUNGSGENAUIGKEIT. DIE ENTWICKLUNG VON VERFAHREN DER RUMLICHEN FILTERUNG KANN VON WERT BEI STDTISCHEN GEBIETEN SEIN, WEIL ES EINE ABHNGIGKEIT DES GRAUWERTES VON DER RELATIVEN AUSDEHNUNG VON GELNDECHARAKTERISTIKA UND DER RICHTUNG DER RADARAUFNAHME GIBT. column1: ULABY FT, 1981, DIG INT GEOSCI REMOTE SENS SYMP
AU: ULABY, F; LI, R; SHANMUGAM, K
CR: NA
AB: IN THE PAST TWO DECADES, MULTISPECTRAL SCANNERS (MSS) HAVE BEEN USED AS THE PRIMARY SENSORS FOR COLLECTING DATA FOR A VARIETY OF REMOTE SENSING APPLICATIONS. MICROWAVE SENSORS NOW PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN SUPPLEMENTING AND/OR REPLACING MSS DATA IN A NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS INCLUDING CROP CLASSIFICATION. THE RESULTS OF A CROP CLASSIFICATION STUDY USING MICROWAVE SCATTEROMETER (RADAR) AND LANDSAT MSS DATA ARE PRESENTED. IN ORDER TO ANALYZE THE STATISTICAL PROPERTIES OF RADAR DATA, A MULTIPLICATIVE MODEL FOR RADAR DATA IS PROPOSED. THIS MODEL IS USED FOR ANLAYZING THE WITHIN-FIELD AND BETWEEN-FIELD VARIATION IN RADAR DATA, AND FOR DERIVING CLASSIFICATION ALGORITHMS. RESULTS OF CROP-CLASSIFICATION STUDIES PERFORMED USING RADAR AND LANDSAT DATA COLLECTED OVER A TEST SITE IN COLBY, KANSAS ARE PRESENTED. THESE RESULTS SHOW THAT THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY OF RADAR IS COMPARABLE TO THAT OF LANDSAT DATA AND THAT ADDITION OF RADAR DATA TO LANDSAT DATA IMPROVES THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY BY ABOUT 10%.

AB: MICROWAVE RADAR CAN PENETRATE CLOUD COVER; AND BECAUSE IT CARRIES ITS OWN ILLUMINATION SOURCE, IT CAN BE USED DAY OR NIGHT, WHICH MAKES IT A POTENTIAL REMOTE SENSING TOOL FOR AGRICULTURE. BUT FIRST THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT (THE MEASURED RADAR CROSS SECTION IN M2 DIVIDED BY THE AREA ILLUMINATED IN M2) AND CROP PARAMETERS MUST BE DETERMINED. THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT HAS BEEN RELATED TO SOIL MOISTURE, CROP CLASSIFICATION, AND PLANT MOISTURE. IN THE SPRING AND SUMMER OF 1979 KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY COLLABORATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS REMOTE SENSING LABORATORY TO ASSESS THE MICROWAVE RESPONSE TO CANOPY MOISTURE, LEAF-AREA INDEX, AND DRY WEIGHT OF WHEAT, CORN, AND SORGHUM USING A TRUCK-MOUNTED MICROWAVE RADAR UNIT. THE APPROXIMATELY WEEKLY SCANS WERE TAKEN AT FOUR FREQUENCIES (8.6, 13.0, 17.0, AND 35.6 GHZ), THREE ANGLES FROM NADIR (30, 50, AND 70), AND THREE POLARIZATIONS (HH, HV, AND VV). THE HIGHEST CORRELATIONS OF THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT WITH CANOPY MOISTURE (MILLIMETERS OF WATER DIVIDED BY PLANT HEIGHT) AND LEAF-AREA INDEX OCCURRED AT 30. AT HIGHER ANGLES THE RADAR WAS LESS RESPONSIVE AS IT LOOKED MORE THROUGH THE SIDE OF THE CANOPY. PLANT DRY WEIGHT'S HIGHEST CORRELATION WITH THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT WAS AT 70, INDICATING THAT DRY WEIGHT IS RELATED TO SURFACE ROUGHNESS. LEAF-AREA INDEX AND DRY WEIGHT WERE MODELED AS FUNCTIONS OF THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT, SPECTRAL REFLECTANCE RATIOS, AND CANOPY TEMPERATURE. DIURNAL READINGS OF THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT WERE FOUND TO BE UNRESPONSIVE TO WINDSPEED OR LEAF WATER POTENTIAL.  1981.

AB: THIS PAPER CONSIDERS TWO ASPECTS OF THE MICROWAVE INTERACTION WITH VEGETATION MEDIA. THE FIRST ASPECT FOCUSES ON THE RADAR BACKSCATTER BEHAVIOR AS A FUNCTION OF THE VEGETATION GEOMETRICAL AND ELECTRICAL PROPERTIES. EXPERIMENTAL DATA COVERING THE 1-18 GHZ REGION ARE USED TO (A) MODEL THE VEGETATION CANOPY AS A WATER CLOUD, (B) EVALUATE THE ATTENUATION BY THE CANOPY, AND (C) GENERATE A VEGETATION CLUTTER MODEL DESCRIBING THE STATISTICAL DISTRIBUTION OF VEGETATION BACKSCATTER UNDER A WIDE RANGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS. THE SECOND ASPECT OF THIS PAPER FOCUSES ON THE USE OF RADAR FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION. MULTITEMPORAL DATA ARE USED TO EVALUATE CROP CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY OF RADAR ALONE AND IN CONJUNCTION WITH LANDSAT DATA. IN ADDITION, THE ROLE OF RADAR AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR OPTICAL SENSORS DURING CLOUD-COVERED PASSES IS EVALUATED.  1981.

column1: RIOM J, 1980, BULL SOC FR PHOTOGRAMM TELEDETECT
AU: RIOM, J; LE, T, T
CR: NA
AB: THE JUNE 21, 1977 AIRBORNE IMAGERY OF MARITIME PINE FORESTS IN THE DAX REGION WAS ANALYZED BY THE MICRODENSITOMETRY OF FILMS PRODUCED BY OPTICAL PROCESSING, WITHOUT GEOMETRIC CORRECTIONS. THIS ANALYSIS SHOWED THAT THERE IS A RELATION BETWEEN TREE HEIGHT AND RADAR BACKSCATTERING AND THAT THE IMAGES GIVE A GOOD DIFFERENTIATION BETWEEN THE AGES OF THE VARIOUS TREE GROUPS. A TEXTURAL ANALYSIS, BASED ON DIFFERENT INDICATIONS CONCERNING HOMOGENEITY, CONTRAST AND THE PRESENCE OF ORGANIZED STRUCTURES IN THE IMAGE, ALSO MADE IT POSSIBLE TO DISCRIMINATE BETWEEN CROPS, ZONES WHERE THE TREES HAVE BEEN FELLED, AND FORESTS. THE COMBINED USE OF THE TWO POLARIZATIONS (HH AND HV) IMPROVED THE CLASSIFICATION.

AB: RESULTS OFAN INVESTIGATION OFRADAR DATA AS EMPLOYED IN AN AUTOMATED CROP INVENTORY MODEL ARE PRESENTED. TAKING A MONTE CARLO APPROACH, RADAR IMAGERY WAS SIMULATED AND SUBJECTED TO BAYESIAN CLASSIFICATION TECHNIQUES TO DETERMINE THOSE RADARPARAMETERS MOST SUITABLE FOR CROP SPECIES IDENTIFICATION. A RADAR OPERATING AT ABOUT 14 GHZ WITH A VVANTENNA CONFIGURATION VIEWING THE TARGET IN THE 45 TO 55 ANGLE OF INCIDENCE RANGE SEEMS MOST SUITABLE FOR CROP IDENTIFICATION PURPOSES. STUDIES HAVE INDICATED, HOWEVER, THAT THE TEMPORAL DIMENSION (MULTI-DATA IMAGERY) MUST ALSO BE EMPLOYEDFOR SUCCESSFUL CROP IDENTIFICATION. FOR EXAMPLE, BY REVISITING A FIELDFOUR TIMES IN 30 DAYS WITH A DUAL POLARIZED 14.2 GHZ SYSTEM, IT APPEARSFEASTBLE TO CLASSIFY AGRICULTURALFIELDS WITH BETTER THAN 90 PERCENT ACCURACY. COMPARISON OF RESULTS USING RADARS OF OTHER CONFIGURATIONS ARE ALSO PRESENTED FOR VARYING FIELD REVISIT PERIODS.  1978, CANADIAN SPACE AGENCY/AGENCE SPATIALE CANADIENNE. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

AB: A 13.3 GHZ SCATTEROMETER AND A NADIR-VIEWING RADIOMETER MEASURING REFLECTED RADIANCE IN THE LANDSAT BANDS WERE FLOWN SIMULTANEOUSLY OVER A NUMBER OF FIELDS NEAR OTTAWA CONTAINING ELEVEN DIFFERENT FORAGE CROPS. THE PURPOSE OF THE EXPERIMENT WAS TO COMPARE THE RELATIVE ABILITY OF THE OPTICAL AND MICROWAVE SENSORS TO DIFFERENTIATE THE VARIOUS CROP TYPES, AND TO INVESTIGATE THE ADVANTAGES OF COMBINING OPTICAL AND MICROWAVE MEASUREMENTS FOR CROP DISCRIMINATION.THE COHERENT ILLUMINATION AND DETECTION INHERENT IN THE SCATTEROMETER OPERATION RESULTS IN ANALYSIS TECHNIQUES AND STATISTICAL UNCERTAINTIES WHICH ARE QUITE DIFFERENT FROM THOSE ASSOCIATED WITH THE MORE TRADITIONAL OPTICAL TECHNIQUES. THE DATA REDUCTION PROCEDURE AND RESULTING UNCERTAINTIES ARE DISCUSSED IN SOME DETAIL.CONFUSION MATRICES WERE CALCULATED FOR BOTH THE OPTICAL AND THE MICROWAVE DATA. MICROWAVE AND OPTICAL SENSORS PROVIDE COMPLEMENTARY INFORMATION WHICH, WHEN COMBINED, PERMIT THE MOST ACCURATE (88.4  8.0 (S.D.) % FOR 9 CLASSES) CLASSIFICATIONS TO BE ACHIEVED. THE BETTER SINGLE SENSOR BASED ON CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY IS A MULTISPECTRAL OPTICAL SENSOR. WE FOUND THAT THE MOST SIGNIFICANT FEATURES DERIVABLE FROM THE SCATTEROMETER DATA WERE THE DUAL-POLARIZED SCATTERING COEFFICIENTS AT NADIR AND THE LINEAR SLOPES OF THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENTS AS A FUNCTION OF OBSERVATION ANGLE. WE RECOMMEND AS FOLLOW-ON TO THIS EXPERIMENT AN EXPERIMENT IN WHICH A COMPARISON OF IMAGING RADAR DATA WITH MULTISPECTRAL SCANNER DATA IS MADE.  1978, CANADIAN SPACE AGENCY/AGENCE SPATIALE CANADIENNE. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

AB: RESULTS OF AN INVESTIGATION TO SPECIFY THE PARAMETERS OF A SPACE-BORNE IMAGING RADAR FOR USE IN CROP IDENTIFICATION ARE DISCUSSED. THE STUDY RELIED UPON SCALTERING DATA ACQUIRED WITH A GROUNDBASED RADAR WHICH WERE DEGRADED TO SIMULATE THE PERFORMANCE OF A SYSTEM SIMILAR TO THE PROPOSED SPACE SHUTTLE ORBITER IMAGING RADAR. DATA ACQUIRED FROM FIELDS SOWN IN CORN, MILO, SOYBEANS, WHEAT AND ALFALFA WERE EMPLOYED. THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY SUGGEST THAT FOR BEST CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY, A K-BAND (APPROXIMATELY 14 GHZ), DUAL POLARIZED SYSTEM VIEWING FIELDS AT AN OFF NADIR ANGLE IN THE 40 TO 60 RANGE SHOULD BE EMPLOYED. HOWEVER IT IS EMPHASIZED THAT TO ATTAIN CLASSIFICATION ACCURACIES EXCEEDING 90%, MULTI-DATE ACQUISITION IS REQUIRED. AS BEST AS CAN BE DETERMINED, FOUR TARGET REVISITS AT AN INTERVAL OF TEN DAYS IS ADEQUATE FOR 90% ACCURACY.  1978.

AB: RESEARCH DURING THE PAST FIVE YEARS HAS ENABLED US TO DEFINE CERTAIN POTENTIALS AND PROBLEMS IN THE USE OF RADAR IMAGING SYSTEMS FOR MAPPING AND RESOURCE EVALUATION. THIS REVIEW ARTICLE CONCENTRATES ON THE APPLICATIONS AND DIFFICULTIES ENCOUNTERED WITH A MULTIPLE POLARIZATION K-BAND REAL APERTURE RADAR SYSTEM AND TOUCHES VERY BRIEFLY ON POSSIBLE APPLICATIONS OF SYNTHETIC APERTURE, MULTI-FREQUENCY, PANCHROMATIC, AND OTHER SYSTEMS. APPLICATION STUDIES HAVE SHOWN THAT IMAGING RADAR MAY BE USEFUL ADJUNCT TO AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY AND IN SOME CASES AN ACCEPTABLE SUBSTITUTE FOR PHOTOGRAPHY IN THE STUDY OF BROAD SCALE GEOLOGIC STRUCTURES, AND IN DERIVING STREAM NETWORK PARAMETERS IN REGIONS WHERE MAPPING IS INADEQUATE. A REVIEW IS ALSO GIVEN OF STUDIES ON CROP DISCRIMINATION WITH RADAR, IN THE MAPPING OF NATURAL VEGETATION, AND IN CERTAIN TYPES OF REGIONAL LAND CLASSIFICATIONS.  1970.
C1: PROF. DR. DAVID S. SIMONETT, DEPARTMENT OF GEOGRAPHY, UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS, LAWRENCE, KA. 66044, UNITED STATES
DE: NA
ID: NA
RP: SIMONETT, D.S.; PROF. DR. DAVID S. SIMONETT, DEPARTMENT OF GEOGRAPHY, UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS, LAWRENCE, KA. 66044, UNITED STATES
TI: REMOTE SENSING WITH IMAGING RADAR A REVIEW

column1: KOHL HG, 1994, EARTH OBSERVATION QUARTERLY
AU: KOHL, H; NEZRY, E; DE, G, H
CR: NA
AB: IN PREVIOUS STUDIES IT WAS SHOWN THAT THE COMBINATION OF ERS-1 FAST-DELIVERY (FD) AND SPOT IMAGERY IMPROVES SIGNIFICANTLY THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY OF AGRICULTURAL CROPS, IF COMPARED TO A SINGLE SPOT-XS SCENE. MORE RECENTLY, THE WORK HAS BEEN DIRECTED TOWARDS THE INDEPENDENT ANALYSIS OF HIGH DIMENSIONAL, MULTI-DATE ERS-1 PRI DATASETS. NINE IMAGES OF THE AGRICULTURAL SEASON 1992-1993 OVER THE SEVILLE (SPAIN) SITE OF THE MARS PROJECT WERE ANALYSED AND COMPARED TO THE RESULTS OBTAINED WITH MULTI-DATE SPOT IMAGERY. THE PREPROCESSING METHODS USED WERE BASED ON AN ENHANCED STRUCTURE RETAINING GAMMA-GAMMA MAP SPECKLE FILTER TAKING NOW INTO ACCOUNT ALSO SECOND-ORDER STATISTICS. THE THEMATIC ANALYSIS HAS BEEN IMPROVED BY THE USE OF HISTORICAL LAND-USE INFORMATION. -FROM AUTHORS

THE DLR INSTITUTE OF RADIO FREQUENCY TECHNOLOGY PARTICIPATED WITH ITS EXPERIMENTAL SAR SYSTEM (E-SAR) IN X-, C-, AND L-BAND, HH AND VV POLARISATIONS TO INVESTIGATE MICROWAVE BACKSCATTERING MECHANISMS OF AGRICULTURAL CROP TYPES. BACKSCATTER CURVES FOR SIX CROPS ARE SHOWN, WHICH INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY FOR CROP MONITORING AND PREFERRED TIMES FOR CROP CLASSIFICATION. -FROM AUTHORS

column1: CURRAN PJ, 1990, REMOTE SENSING OF SOILS AND VEGETATION IN THE USSR
AU: CURRAN, P; FOODY, G; KONDRATYEV, K; KOZODEROV, V; FEDCHENKO, P
CR: NA
AB: THE AIM OF THIS TEXT IS TO MAKE THE ENGLISH-SPEAKING RESEARCH COMMUNITY AWARE OF SOVIET WORK ON THE REMOTE SENSING OF SOILS AND VEGETATION. THE AUTHORS CONCENTRATE ON AREAS THAT MAKE SOVIET RESEARCH DIFFERENT FROM THAT OF THE WEST, AND SO MANY OF THE TRADITIONAL RESEARCH AREAS OF GIS, SAR, AND LANDCOVER CLASSIFICATION ARE ABSENT. A NUMBER OF THEMES ARE EMPHASISED: THE USE OF COLOUR AS A REMOTE SENSING TRANSFORM; THE INTERACTION OF ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION WITH THE ENVIRONMENT; THE ESTIMATION OF SOIL HUMUS, LEAF CHLOROPHYLL, CROP WEEDS AND SENESCENCE; AND SCALING UP ESTIMATION TECHNIQUES FROM LABORATORY TO LANDSCAPE. IN ORDER TO HIGHLIGHT THESE THEMES, FOUR KEY TOPICS HAVE BEEN CHOSEN: THEORETICAL ASPECTS OF SPECTROMETRY AND COLOUR MEASUREMENT; REMOTE SENSING OF VEGETATION FROM LABORATORY TO AIRCRAFT; REMOTE SENSING OF SOILS FROM LABORATORY TO AIRCRAFT; AND REMOTE SENSING OF SOILS AND CROPS FROM AIRCRAFT TO SATELLITE. THE BOOK CONCLUDES WITH A BIOGRAPHY OF WORK OF INTERNATIONAL AUTHORSHIP. -AFTER AUTHORS

AU: THOMSON, K; EDWARDS, G; LANDRY, R; JATON, A; CADIEUX, S; GWYN, Q
CR: NA
AB: THIS PAPER PRESENTS THE RESULTS OF AN EXPERIMENT ON THE APPLICATION OF SAR DATA FOR CROP CLASSIFICATION AT AN AGRICULTURAL SITE IN QUEBEC. THE MAIN ASPECTS DISCUSSED INCLUDE THE CORRELATION OF X AND C BAND DATA FOR 14 VEGETATION TYPES AND THE COMPARISON OF A PIXEL CLASSIFICATION AND A CLASSIFICATION USING SEGMENTATION RESULTS. THE SEGMENTATION METHODOLOGY USES A NEW ALGORITHM WHICH INCORPORATES CARTOGRAPHIC INFORMATION INTO THE SEGMENTATION PROCESS. -FROM AUTHORS

column1: ALPARONE L, 1989, NA
AU: ALPARONE, L; BENELLI, G; CAPPELLINI, V
CR: NA
AB: DIGITAL TECHNIQUES FOR IMAGE PROCESSING AND AUTOMATIC CLASSIFICATION IN REMOTE-SENSING APPLICATIONS ARE DESCRIBED. SOME DIGITAL FILTERS SUITABLE FOR RADAR NOISE REDUCTION ARE REVIEWED. A NOVEL FILTERING ALGORITHM FOR MULTIPLICATIVE NOISE REJECTION IS THEN PROPOSED. SOME ALGORITHMS USING THE MAXIMUM-LIKELIHOOD DECISION RULE OR THE EUCLIDEAN DISTANCE ARE APPLIED TO PREPROCESSED IMAGES FOR AN AUTOMATIC DISCRIMINATION OF AGRICULTURAL CROPS. MICROWAVE IMAGES OBTAINED BY MEANS OF SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADARS AND COLLECTED DURING THE EUROPEAN SAR 580 CAMPAIGN ARE USED TO EVALUATE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE FILTERING ALGORITHMS. BOTH SINGLE-BAND AND TWO-BAND CLASSIFICATION WITH A CORRECT CLASSIFICATION PROBABILITY OF OVER 95% WERE OBTAINED.
C1: DEP OF ELECTR ENG, UNIV OF FLORENCE,, FLORENCE, ITALY
DE: NA

column1: BRISCO B, 1989, CANADIAN JOURNAL OF REMOTE SENSING
AU: BRISCO, B; BROWN, R; MANORE, M
CR: NA
AB: TWO DATES OF C-HH SAR DATA ACQUIRED OVER THE NORTH BATTLEFORD, SASKATCHEWAN, AREA ION THE EARLY PART (MAY 10 AND JUNE 12) OF THE 1987 GROWING SEASON WERE USED ALONE AND IN COMBINATION WITH A TM SCENE (MAY 24) TO INVESTIGATE THE CROP CLASSIFICATION ABILITY OF THESE DATA. SUPERVISED MAXIMUM LIKELIHOOD CLASSIFICATION TECHNIQUES WERE USED TO DISCRIMINATE FIELDS OF EARLY- AND LATE-PLANTED CANOLA, GRAIN, SUMMER-FALLOW, PEA, AND LENTIL CROP TYPES. THE RESULTS ARE DISCUSSED IN RELATIONSHIP TO THE CROP CALENDAR AND THE POTENTIAL FOR IMPROVEMENT BY ADDING DATA ACQUIRED DURING LATER PERIODS IN THE GROWING SEASON. WHEN RADARSAT IS LAUNCHED AND MULTI-TEMPORAL SAR DATA ARE READILY AVAILABLE, ACCURATE CROP DISCRIMINATION USING SAR DATA AUGMENTED BY TM DATA WILL BE ATTAINABLE. -FROM AUTHORS

column1: HOOGEBOOM P, 1986, REMOTE SENSING FOR RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT AND ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT PROC 7TH ISPRS COMMISSION VII SYMPOSIUM, ENSCHEDE, 1986 VOL 1
AU: HOOGEBOOM, P
CR: NA
AB: IN 1980 A LARGE SLAR FLIGHT PROGRAM WAS CARRIED OUT OVER AN AGRICULTURAL AREA IN THE NETHERLANDS. A CLASSIFICATION STUDY ON THIS MULTITEMPORAL DATASET SHOWED THAT HIGH ACCURACIES ARE OBTAINED FROM A SIMULTANEOUS CLASSIFICATION OF 3 FLIGHTS. IN THIS PAPER THE RESULTS OF A FOLLOW-ON STUDY WILL BE DISCUSSED. THE GOAL IS TO OBTAIN THE BEST POSSIBLE CLASSIFICATION RESULT IN THE EARLIEST POSSIBLE STAGE OF THE GROWING SEASON. THEREFORE THE SLAR FLIGHTS FROM APRIL, MAY, JUNE AND JULY WERE ANALYZED AND THE HIERARCHIC CLASSIFIER IS INTRODUCED. VERY SATISFYING RESULTS WERE OBTAINED FROM A COMBINATION OF 3 FLIGHTS: 1 IN MAY, 2 IN JULY AT DIFFERENT INCIDENCE ANGLES. -AUTHOR

CR: NA
AB: BOTH C- AND L-BAND RADAR DATA ACQUIRED OVER A TEST SITE NEAR COLBY, KANSAS DURING THE SUMMER OF 1979 WERE USED TO IDENTIFY THREE TYPES OF VEGETATION COVER AND BARE SOIL. THE EFFECTS OF FREQUENCY, POLARIZATION, AND THE LOOK ANGLE ON THE OVERALL ACCURACY OF RECOGNIZING THE FOUR TYPES OF GROUND COVER WERE ANALYZED. IN ADDITION, MULTIDATE DATA WERE USED TO STUDY THE IMPROVEMENT IN RECOGNITION ACCURACY POSSIBLE WITH THE ADDITION OF TEMPORAL INFORMATION. -FROM NASA ABSTRACT E82-10281 ENGLISH

column1: ULABY FT, 1981, NA-a
AU: ULABY, F; LI, R; SHANMUGAM, K
CR: NA
AB: AIRBORNE RADAR DATA ACQUIRED WITH A 13.3 GHZ SCATTEROMETER OVER A TEST-SITE NEAR COLBY, KANSAS WERE USED TO INVESTIGATE THE STATISTICAL PROPERTIES OF THE SCATTERING COEFFICIENT OF THREE TYPES OF VEGETATION COVER AND OF BARE SOIL. A STATISTICAL MODE FOR RADAR DATA WAS DEVELOPED THAT INCORPORATES SIGNAL-FADING AND NATURAL WITHIN-FIELD VARIABILITIES. ESTIMATES OF THE WITHIN-FIELD AND BETWEEN-FIELD COEFFICIENTS OF VARIATION WERE OBTAINED FOR EACH COVER-TYPE AND COMPARED WITH SIMILAR QUANTITIES DERIVED FROM LANDSAT IMAGES OF THE SAME FIELDS. THE CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY PROVIDED BY LANDSAT ALONE, RADAR ALONE, AND BOTH SENSORS COMBINED WAS INVESTIGATED. -FROM NASA ABSTRACT E83-10255

column1: RIOM J, 1980, SOCIETE FRANCAISE DE PHOTOGRAMMETRIE ET DE TELEDETECTION, BULLETIN
AU: RIOM, J; LE, T, T
CR: NA
AB: THE 21 JUNE 1977 AIRBORNE IMAGERY OF MARITIME PINE FORESTS IN THE DAX REGION WAS ANALYSED BY MICRODENSITOMETRY OF FILMS PRODUCED BY OPTICAL PROCESSING, WITHOUT GEOMETRIC CORRECTIONS. THIS ANALYSIS SHOWED THAT THERE IS A RELATION BETWEEN TREE HEIGHT AND RADAR BACKSCATTERING AND THAT THE IMAGES GIVE A GOOD DIFFERENTIATION BETWEEN THE AGES OF THE VARIOUS TREE GROUPS. A TEXTURAL ANALYSIS, BASED ON DIFFERENT INDICATIONS CONCERNING HOMOGENEITY, CONTRAST AND THE PRESENCE OF ORGANIZED STRUCTURES IN THE IMAGE, ALSO MADE IT POSSIBLE TO DISCRIMINATE BETWEEN CROPS, ZONES WHERE THE TREES HAVE BEEN FELLED AND FORESTS. THE COMBINED USE OF THE 2 POLARIZATIONS (HH AND HV) IMPROVED THE CLASSIFICATION. -FROM ENGLISH SUMMARY

AU: GOODENOUGH, D; TEILLET, P; GUINDON, B
CR: NA
AB: AIRBORNE SAR AND LANDSAT MSS IMAGERY WERE OBTAINED IN THE SUMMER OF 1978 FOR AN AGRICULTURAL SITE LOCATED NEAR GRAND FALLS, NEW BRUNSWICK. LANDSAT IMAGERY WAS CORRECTED ON THE DICS SYSTEM AT CCRS. FOR THE HIGH RESOLUTION AIRBORNE SAR DATA, A NEW RECTIFICATION PROCEDURE WAS DEVELOPED WHICH MODELS THE AIRCRAFT FLIGHT PARAMETERS AND UTILIZES TERRAIN INFORMATION, IN THE FORM OF A DIGITAL TERRAIN MODEL (DTM), IN ORDER TO REMOVE IMAGE DISTORTIONS INTRODUCED BY TOPOGRAPHIC RELIEF. THIS PROCEDURE, WHICH CAN ALSO BE USED TO CORRECT AIRBORNE MSS IMAGERY, ALLOWS THE USER TO ACHIEVE POSITIONAL ACCURACIES OF +- 20M RELATIVE TO THE MAP GRID. WITH FURTHER PROCESSING CHANNELS FROM DIFFERENT FLIGHT LINES CAN BE OVERLAID TO AN ACCURACY OF LESS THAN 6M IN EACH COORDINATE DIRECTION. USING A FEATURE SELECTION TECHNIQUE, WE DETERMINED WHICH COMBINATION OF MSS AND RADAR CHANNELS PROVIDED THE GREATEST SEPARABILITY AMONG THE MAJOR TARGET TYPES IN THE GRAND FALLS AREA (I.E. POTATOES, GRAINS, PASTURE, FALLOW AND FOREST). IN ADDITION AN INVESTIGATION OF THE EFFECT OF IMAGE RESOLUTION ON CLASSIFICATION ACCURACY WAS CARRIED OUT USING THE SAR DATA. -FROM AUTHORS

CR: NA
AB: A COMBINED LANDSAT/RADAR APPROACH TO CLASSIFICATION OF REMOTELY SENSED DATA, WITH EMPHASIS ON CROPS, WAS UNDERTAKEN. RADAR DATA WERE OBTAINED BY MICROWAVE RADAR SPECTROMETERS OVER FIELDS NEAR EUDORA, KANSAS AND LANDSAT IMAGE DATA WERE OBTAINED FOR THE SAME TEST SITE. AFTER LANDSAT DIGITAL IMAGES WERE REGISTERED AND TEST-CELLS EXTRACTED, A COMPARABLE SET OF RADAR IMAGE PIXELS WERE SIMULATED TO MATCH THE LANDSAT PIXELS. THE COMBINED DATA SET IS THEN USED FOR CLASSIFICATION, AND THE RESULTS ARE EXAMINED WITH THE BEST COMBINATION OF SENSOR VARIABLES IDENTIFIED. FINALLY, THE USEFULNESS OF RADAR IN A SIMULATED CLOUD-COVER SITUATION IS DEMONSTRATED. THE MAJOR CONCLUSION DERIVED FROM THIS STUDY IS THAT THE COMBINATION OF RADAR/OPTICAL SENSORS IS SUPERIOR TO EITHER ONE ALONE.
